packagegui.name: tinc
packagegui.title: VPN: tinc

field.description: This is the name which identifies this tinc daemon. It must be unique for the virtual private network this daemon will connect to.
IP Address of local tunnel interface. This is often the same IP as your routers LAN address, for example 192.168.2.1
Subnet behind this router that should be advertised to the mesh. This is usually your LAN subnet, for example 192.168.2.0/24
This is the Netmask that defines what traffic is routed to the VPNs tunnel interface. It is usually broader then your local netmask, for example 255.255.0.0

This option affects the address family of listening and outgoing sockets. If "any" is selected, then depending on the operating system both IPv4 and IPv6 or just IPv6 listening sockets will be created.
RSA private key used for this host. Include the BEGIN and END lines.
RSA public key used for this host. Include the BEGIN and END lines.
This will generate a new RSA key pair in the fields above.
Anything entered here will be added at the end of the tinc.conf configuration file.
Anything entered here will be added just prior to the public certiciate in the host configuration file for this machine.

This script is executed right after the tinc daemon has connected to the virtual network device. By default a tinc-up file is created that brings up the tinc interface with the IP Address and Netmask specified above and adds it to the tinc interface group. Entering a value here complely replaces the default script so be sure to bring up the interface in this script.
This script is executed right before the tinc daemon is going to close.
This script is executed when any host becomes reachable.
This script is executed when any host becomes unreachable.
This script is executed when any subnet becomes reachable.
This script is executed when any subnet becomes unreachable.
